physworldcallbackmanager.cpp

00001 #ifndef PHYSWORLDCALLBACKMANAGER_CPP
00002 #define PHYSWORLDCALLBACKMANAGER_CPP
00003 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00004 //Ogre Frame rendering callbacks are implemented here
00005 //
00006 //Since Ogre handles the main loop, most of our interactions for the game logic
00007 //need to interact with this, and the most consistent interface is the ogre
00008 //frame listener, so we created this wrapper around that.
00009 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00010 
00011 //Includes
00012 #include "physworldcallbackmanager.h"
00013 #include "physdatatypes.h"
00014 #include "physworld.h"
00015 
00016 using namespace std;
00017 
00018 
00019 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00020 // PhysWorldFrameListener
00021 ///////////////////////////////////////
00022 PhysWorldCallBackManager::PhysWorldCallBackManager(PhysWorld* _Parent): PreInputCallback(NULL)
00023 {
00024         TheWorldIListenTo = _Parent;
00025 
00026         PreInputCallback = NULL;
00027         PrePhysicsCallback = NULL;
00028         PreRenderCallback = NULL;
00029         PostRenderCallback = NULL;
00030 }
00031 
00032 PhysWorldCallBackManager::~PhysWorldCallBackManager()
00033 {
00034 
00035 }
00036 
00037 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00038 //Preinput callback will be called in the main loop first
00039 ///////////////////////////////////////
00040 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::PreInput()
00041 {
00042         //If a call back has been set then we use it, otherwise we can
00043         //assume that we should just keep execute the main loop
00044         if(NULL!=PreInputCallback)
00045         {
00046                 return (*PreInputCallback)();
00047         }
00048         return true;
00049 }
00050 
00051 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::ErasePreInput()
00052 {
00053         this->PreInputCallback = NULL;
00054 }
00055 
00056 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::SetPreInput(bool (*Callback)())
00057 {
00058         this->PreInputCallback = Callback;
00059 }
00060 
00061 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::IsPreInputCallbackSet()
00062 {
00063         if(NULL==PreInputCallback)
00064         {
00065                 return false;
00066         }
00067         return true;
00068 }
00069 
00070 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00071 // These functions manage the pre physics functions
00072 ///////////////////////////////////////
00073 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::PrePhysics()
00074 {
00075         if(NULL!=PrePhysicsCallback)
00076         {
00077                 return (*PrePhysicsCallback)();
00078         }
00079         return true;
00080 }
00081 
00082 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::ErasePrePhysics()
00083 {
00084         this->PrePhysicsCallback = NULL;
00085 }
00086 
00087 void PhysWorldCallBackManager::SetPrePhysics(bool (*Callback)())
00088 {
00089         this->PrePhysicsCallback = Callback;
00090 }
00091 
00092 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::IsPrePhysicsCallbackSet()
00093 {
00094         if(NULL==PrePhysicsCallback)
00095         {
00096                 return false;
00097         }
00098         return true;
00099 }

00134 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

00137 bool PhysWorldCallBackManager::PostRender()
00138 {
00139         if(NULL!=PostRenderCallback)
00140         {
00141                 return (*PostRenderCallback)();
00142         }
00143         return true;
